events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred during rush hour on the highway, filing the initial claim.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' based on the description of the car collision.
An experienced claims agent specializing in automobile accidents was assigned to handle this case promptly.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the car accident claim and confirmed next steps.
We requested all relevant documents including police report, vehicle photos, and repair estimates.
The insured submitted the requested police report, damage photos, and mechanic's repair estimate.
An internal investigation was initiated to verify the circumstances of the car accident and assess liability.
The investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault and verified claim documents were accurate.
A fair settlement offer covering repair costs and rental vehicle expenses was proposed to the customer.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the settlement proposal and communication.
The claim was officially approved following confirmation of settlement agreement by both parties.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and issued directly to the repair shop and the insured.
The claim was closed successfully after confirming that all payments were received and repairs completed.
The closed claim files were archived securely in the company records for future reference if needed.
